Annotation.note:
Let $(O),(P),(Q)$ be the three excircles of triangle $ABC$. Let $R$, $S$, and $T$ be the three points of contact of circle $(O)$ at the three sides $BC$, $CA$, and $AB$, respectively. For the circles $(P)$ and $(Q)$ we use the similar notations $U$, $V$, and $W$; $X$, $Y$, and $Z$, respectively. Let $D=g(YX)\wedge g(VW)$, $E=g(YX) \wedge g(ST)$, and $F=g(SR) \wedge g(VW)$. Then $D$, $E$, and $F$ are on the corresponding altitudes of triangle $ABC$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
